diagnoses: Vitamin B Deficiencies (e.g., B2, B6, B12)
Drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms (DRESS)
Drug Reaction with Eosinophilia and Systemic Symptoms (DRESS)
Drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms (DRESS)
Drug Reaction with Eosinophilia and Systemic Symptoms (DRESS Syndrome)
Drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms (DRESS)
Drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms (DRESS) syndrome
Drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms (DRESS) syndrome
Drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms (DRESS syndrome)
Drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms (DRESS) syndrome
Psoriatic arthritis (associated with psoriasis and autoimmune features)
Inflammatory bowel disease (Crohn's disease and ulcerative colitis)
Viral infections (e.g., HIV, herpes simplex virus)
Hepatitis B or C with Cryoglobulinemia
Rheumatoid arthritis (RA) with secondary autoimmune conditions
Schizophrenia (in rare cases, linked with systemic inflammation)
Menstrual disorders (generic for conditions causing menorrhagia, not a specific diagnosis)

diagnoses.name: Chronic Myelomonocytic Leukemia
diagnoses.description: A type of cancer that starts in blood-forming cells of the bone marrow and invades the blood. It affects monocytes and causes systemic symptoms.

diagnoses.name: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus
diagnoses.description: An autoimmune disease where the body's immune system mistakenly attacks healthy tissue, causing inflammation and tissue damage in the affected parts of the body.

diagnoses.name: Rheumatoid Arthritis
diagnoses.description: An autoimmune disorder that primarily affects joints but can also cause a wide variety of systemic symptoms.

diagnoses.name: Hypoparathyroidism
diagnoses.description: A condition in which the body produces insufficient parathyroid hormone, leading to low calcium levels that can result in muscle spasms and weakness.

diagnoses.name: Hyperparathyroidism
diagnoses.description: Overactivity of one or more of the parathyroid glands, which can lead to osteopenia due to the high level of calcium leached from bones.

diagnoses.name: Vitamin D Deficiency
diagnoses.description: A condition resulting from low levels of vitamin D, which can lead to muscle weakness and bone pain, affecting bone mineral density.

diagnoses.name: Lyme Disease
diagnoses.description: An infectious disease caused by Borrelia bacteria, spread by ticks. It can cause a wide range of symptoms, including muscular pain and episodic weakness.

diagnoses.name: Multiple Myeloma
diagnoses.description: A type of cancer that forms in a type of white blood cell called a plasma cell, which can cause bone pain and osteopenia.

diagnoses.name: HIV/AIDS
diagnoses.description: A virus that attacks the immune system, which can cause a wide range of symptoms including muscle pain and increased risk of severe hypersensitivity reactions.

diagnoses.name: Paraneoplastic Syndromes
diagnoses.description: A group of rare disorders that are triggered by an abnormal immune system response to a cancerous tumor known as a 'neoplasm', capable of causing widely varied symptoms including muscle weakness.

diagnoses.name: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE)
diagnoses.rationale: SLE can present with multisystem involvement including seizures, arthralgia, and lymphadenopathy. While not classic for polycythemia or hypersensitivity reactions, the systemic inflammation could lead to related hematologic abnormalities and skin reactions.

diagnoses.name: Rheumatoid Arthritis (RA)
diagnoses.rationale: RA primarily causes joint pain but can have systemic features including lymphadenopathy. Seizures are rare but can occur secondary to medications or cerebral vasculitis. Hypersensitivity reactions can also occur due to medication.

diagnoses.name: Sarcoidosis
diagnoses.rationale: This multisystem inflammatory disease can cause lymphadenitis, joint pain, and neurosarcoidosis (which may lead to seizures). Polycythemia is uncommon but could potentially occur secondary to chronic hypoxia.

diagnoses.name: Polycythemia Vera
diagnoses.rationale: A primary blood disorder that can cause seizures due to increased blood viscosity, polycythemia vera can also cause pruritus which is a type of hypersensitivity reaction. Joint pain is a common symptom due to high uric acid levels.

diagnoses.name: Chronic Myeloid Leukemia (CML)
diagnoses.rationale: CML could cause polycythemia. It can also present with joint pain. Though seizures and hypersensitivity reactions are less common, systemic involvement can lead to a wide range of symptoms.

diagnoses.name: Behçet's Disease
diagnoses.rationale: This vasculitis can cause joint pain and central nervous system involvement leading to seizures. Lymphadenopathy is less common but can occur.

diagnoses.name: Primary Sjögren's Syndrome
diagnoses.rationale: This autoimmune disease can cause systemic features such as joint pain and lymphadenopathy. Neurological involvement can potentially lead to seizures, although it is rare.

diagnoses.name: Lyme Disease
diagnoses.rationale: Early disseminated Lyme disease can present with lymphadenopathy, joint pain, and in some cases neurological manifestations such as seizures. Hypersensitivity reactions can occur, including a rash.

diagnoses.name: Epilepsy
diagnoses.rationale: While epilepsy itself is primarily a disorder characterized by seizures, systemic diseases or disorders such as polycythemia can contribute to the seizure threshold or be a part of comorbid conditions.

diagnoses.name: HIV/AIDS
diagnoses.rationale: This virus can cause a wide array of symptoms including lymphadenopathy, joint pain, and neurologic complications that can lead to seizures. Hypersensitivity reactions can occur, especially related to medications.

diagnoses: Secondary hypothyroidism (due to pituitary or hypothalamic disease)

diagnoses.name: Hypothyroidism
diagnoses.description: A condition in which your thyroid gland doesn't produce enough of certain crucial hormones, potentially leading to symptoms like weight gain, increased susceptibility to infections, and attention deficit.

diagnoses.name: Diabetes Mellitus
diagnoses.description: A metabolic disease that results in high blood sugar. Long-term complications can include an increased risk of infection and weight gain. Attention deficit isn't a direct symptom but can occur due to high blood sugar levels affecting overall health.

diagnoses.name: Allergic Rhinitis
diagnoses.description: An allergic response causing itchy, watery eyes, sneezing, and other similar symptoms. It can lead to secondary infections like otitis externa due to eustachian tube dysfunction.

diagnoses.name: Obesity
diagnoses.description: A complex disease involving an excessive amount of body fat. Obesity increases the risk for other diseases and health problems, such as diabetes, heart disease, and certain infections.

diagnoses.name: Chronic Fatigue Syndrome
diagnoses.description: A disorder characterized by extreme fatigue or tiredness that doesn't go away with rest and can't be explained by an underlying medical condition. It can also be associated with immune dysfunction, leading to an increased susceptibility to infections.

diagnoses.name: Depression
diagnoses.description: A mental health disorder characterized by persistently depressed mood or loss of interest in activities, causing significant impairment in daily life. It can lead to weight gain and a lack of attention or focus.

diagnoses.name: Sleep Apnea
diagnoses.description: A potentially serious sleep disorder in which breathing repeatedly stops and starts. It can lead to daytime fatigue, attention deficit, and is often associated with weight gain.

diagnoses.name: Iron Deficiency Anemia
diagnoses.description: A condition in which blood lacks adequate healthy red blood cells, caused by a lack of iron. This can lead to increased susceptibility to infections and attention deficit due to fatigue.

diagnoses.name: Substance Abuse
diagnoses.description: The overindulgence in or dependence on an addictive substance, especially alcohol or drugs. Long-term substance abuse can lead to a wide range of physical and mental health issues, including attention deficit, increased susceptibility to infections, and weight changes.

diagnoses.name: Atopic Dermatitis
diagnoses.description: An inflammatory skin condition causing itchy, red, swollen, and cracked skin. It can lead to secondary infection due to the breakdown of skin barriers and may be associated with allergic conjunctivitis, contributing to irritated eyes.

diagnoses.name: Graves' Disease
diagnoses.description: An autoimmune disorder and a common cause of hyperthyroidism that can lead to an overactive thyroid gland and can indirectly affect other bodily systems.

diagnoses.name: Thyroid Nodules
diagnoses.description: Growths in the thyroid gland that can lead to the overproduction of thyroid hormones, contributing to hyperthyroidism symptoms.

diagnoses.name: Hashimoto's Thyroiditis
diagnoses.description: An autoimmune disease that can cause periods of hyperthyroidism as part of its overall presentation, which typically leads to hypothyroidism.

diagnoses.name: Chronic Sinusitis
diagnoses.description: An ongoing condition characterized by the sinuses becoming inflamed and swollen for at least 12 weeks despite treatment attempts, which can cause congestion and facial pain.

diagnoses.name: Acute Sinusitis
diagnoses.description: A temporary inflammation of the sinuses causing congestion, which may lead to laryngitis due to post-nasal drip.

diagnoses.name: Atherosclerotic Heart Disease
diagnoses.description: A condition characterized by the narrowing of the arteries caused by the buildup of plaque, which could have indirect effects related to systemic inflammation affecting other bodily systems.

diagnoses.name: Laryngopharyngeal Reflux (LPR)
diagnoses.description: A condition in which acid from the stomach makes its way up to the throat and voice box, potentially causing laryngitis and a feeling of congestion.

diagnoses.name: Allergic Rhinitis
diagnoses.description: An allergic reaction that causes inflammation of the nasal passages, often leading to symptoms such as congestion and could potentially exacerbate conditions such as sinusitis.

diagnoses.name: Vocal Cord Nodules or Polyps
diagnoses.description: Noncancerous growths on the vocal cords that can cause laryngitis and are often associated with chronic vocal strain or misuse.

diagnoses.name: Subacute Thyroiditis
diagnoses.description: An inflammatory disorder of the thyroid that is typically temporary but can cause hyperthyroidism during its active phase.

diagnoses: Inflammatory bowel disease (including Crohn's disease and ulcerative colitis)
Drug reaction (with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms)
Drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms (DRESS)
Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) exacerbation with gastrointestinal manifestations

diagnoses.name: Multiple Sclerosis
diagnoses.description: A chronic, typically progressive disease involving damage to the sheaths of nerve cells in the brain and spinal cord, symptoms may include numbness, impairment of speech and of muscular coordination, blurred vision and severe fatigue.

diagnoses.name: Migraine with Aura
diagnoses.description: A type of migraine that involves neurological phenomena (aura) like visual disturbances (scotomas) before the actual migraine headache begins.

diagnoses.name: Stroke
diagnoses.description: A condition where poor blood flow to the brain results in cell death, causing symptoms such as paralysis or loss of muscle movement (weakness), numbness, and problems with speech and vision.

diagnoses.name: Transient Ischemic Attack
diagnoses.description: Often called a mini-stroke, a transient ischemic attack is a brief, temporary disruption of blood supply to part of the brain, spinal cord, or retina, causing stroke-like symptoms such as paralysis or sudden weakness, numbness, and visual problems.

diagnoses.name: Guillain-Barre Syndrome
diagnoses.description: A rare disorder in which your body's immune system attacks your nerves, leading to symptoms like weakness, numbness, and tingling.

diagnoses.name: Diabetic Neuropathy
diagnoses.description: A type of nerve damage that can occur with diabetes, leading to numbness, tingling, and weakness in various parts of the body, including the hands and feet.

diagnoses.name: Vitamin B12 Deficiency
diagnoses.description: A lack of B12 can lead to neurological problems such as numbness and tingling in the hands and feet, muscle weakness, and problems with balance.

diagnoses.name: Lyme Disease
diagnoses.description: An infectious disease caused by the Borrelia bacterium which is spread by ticks. Early symptoms may include fever, headache, fatigue, depression, and a characteristic skin rash. If left untreated, it can lead to more serious symptoms including neurological complications.

diagnoses.name: Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS)
diagnoses.description: Also known as Lou Gehrig’s Disease, it affects nerve cells in the brain and the spinal cord, causing loss of muscle control, weakness, and numbness.

diagnoses.name: Brain Tumor
diagnoses.description: An abnormal growth of cells within the brain or the skull, which can cause various neurological symptoms depending on its location, such as weakness, numbness, seizures, and visual disturbances.

diagnoses: Viral Infections (e.g., Dengue Fever, Zika Virus)
Schizophrenia (for psychosis, given no direct relation, this reflects a possible co-occurrence rather than a cause)
Evans Syndrome (Autoimmune Hemolytic Anemia with Thrombocytopenia)

diagnoses.name: Lupus Erythematosus
diagnoses.description: An autoimmune disease characterized by inflammation and a wide variety of symptoms, including skin rash, photosensitivity, and sometimes proteinuria due to kidney involvement.

diagnoses.name: Dermatomyositis
diagnoses.description: An inflammatory disease marked by muscle weakness and skin rash, including photosensitivity and telangiectasias.

diagnoses.name: Scleroderma
diagnoses.description: A group of autoimmune diseases that cause skin and connective tissue to harden and tighten. It can feature telangiectasias and postinflammatory dyspigmentation.

diagnoses.name: Rosacea
diagnoses.description: A chronic skin condition that causes redness and visible blood vessels in your face. It can also present with telangiectasias and postinflammatory dyspigmentation.

diagnoses.name: Porphyria
diagnoses.description: A group of liver disorders in which substances called porphyrins build up in the body, negatively affecting the skin or nervous system. It can cause photosensitive rash.

diagnoses.name: Polymorphous Light Eruption
diagnoses.description: A skin condition caused by a reaction to sunlight, leading to a rash that can be itchy or burn. It’s characterized by photosensitive rash.

diagnoses.name: Bloom Syndrome
diagnoses.description: A rare genetic disorder characterized by short stature, sun-sensitive skin changes, and a predisposition to the development of cancer. It includes symptoms like telangiectasias and photosensitive rash.

diagnoses.name: Cutaneous Lupus Erythematosus
diagnoses.description: A form of lupus erthyematosus that is limited to the skin and is characterized by rash and lesions, usually made worse by exposure to sunlight.

diagnoses.name: Systemic Sclerosis
diagnoses.description: An autoimmune disorder characterized by changes in the skin, blood vessels, muscles, and internal organs. Skin changes can include telangiectasias and dyspigmentation.

diagnoses.name: Atopic Dermatitis
diagnoses.description: A condition that makes your skin red and itchy. It's common in children but can occur at any age. It can involve postinflammatory dyspigmentation and, in some cases, may become worse with sun exposure.
